subject: Programming
title: What Clean Code Means
description: A short lesson to help you apply What Clean Code Means.

hook.text: Code is read ten times more often than it's written. Clean code optimizes for the reader.

buildup.text: Robert C. Martin defined clean code as code that reads like well-written prose.

discovery.text: Clean code does one thing well, has clear intent, and contains no surprises.

twist.text: Writing clean code takes longer initially. But debugging messy code takes far longer.

climax.text: Clean code isn't about beauty. It's about reducing the cost of change over time.

punchline.text: Write for the reader, not the compiler.

quiz.question: Who defined clean code as reading like well-written prose?
